alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 1:30AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Bell, southern Knox and central Whitley Counties through 200 AM EDT... At 130 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wilton, or 9 miles west of Barbourville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Indian Creek, Dishman Springs, Bentley Station and Louden around 135 AM EDT. Swan Lake, Clate, King, Permon, Gausdale, Emmanuel, Lowell, Baileys Switch and Carpenter around 140 AM EDT. Barbourville, Swanpond, Hubbs, Bryants Store, Boone Heights, Heidrick, Birdseye, Yeager and Bimble around 145 AM EDT. Trosper, Myrick, Avis, Brush Creek, Artemus, Kayjay, Himyar, Wheeler and Baughman around 150 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Fourmile, Ingram, Flat Lick, Old Flat Lick and Davisburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
